clusters.title: Breaking: One man dead, another seriously injured in shooting outside inner Sydney pub
clusters.neutral_headline: One man dies, another injured in Sydney pub shooting
bullet_summary: Reported by ABC News Australia, 9News, The Age

items.title: Breaking: One man dead, another seriously injured in shooting outside inner Sydney pub
items.standfirst: One man has died and another has been seriously injured in a shooting outside a hotel in Sydney's inner-city.
items.content: One man has died and another has been seriously injured in a shooting outside a hotel in Sydney's inner-city.

items.title: One man dead after double shooting outside Sydney pub
items.standfirst: One man has been left dead and another injured after a shooting outside a hotel in Sydney's inner west.
items.content: One man has been left dead and another injured after a shooting near a pub in Sydney's inner west.Police were called to the Harold Park Hotel on Ross Street in Forest Lodge following reports of a public place shooting at about 6.40pm.Officers arrived to find two men shot multiple times by people who had left the scene in a car before police arrived.READ MORE: Businesses devastated after suspected firebombing in BrisbaneBoth men suffered multiple gunshot wounds each with NSW Ambulance paramedics treating them at the scene, however one man could not be saved.The other was taken to hospital in a serious condition.Witnesses reported hearing between six and 12 gunshots.One local told the Sydney Morning Herald she saw one of the men shot about six times."He had been shot multiple times, at least six times," she said."But he was still conscious, and they put him in the ambulance so hopefully he makes a full recovery."A crime scene's been set up as police investigate the incident.Anyone with information is being urged to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or https://nsw.crimestoppers.com.auDOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

items.title: One dead, one critical after shooting at Forest Lodge’s Harold Park Hotel
items.standfirst: The landmark pub was the scene of a fatal shooting on Sunday night, which has left one man dead and another in a critical condition.
items.content: The landmark pub was the scene of a fatal shooting on Sunday night, which has left one man dead and another in a critical condition.

clusters.ai_summary:
• A shooting occurred outside a pub in Sydney's inner city.
• One man died as a result of the shooting.
• Another man sustained serious injuries in the incident.
• Police are investigating the circumstances of the shooting.
• The shooting took place at the Harold Park Hotel in Forest Lodge.

clusters.title: Dad stabbed 11 times trying to fight back against gang who broke into home
clusters.neutral_headline: Father stabbed multiple times during home invasion

items.title: Dad stabbed 11 times trying to fight back against gang who broke into home
items.standfirst: A father has been stabbed with a machete while trying to fight back against a gang who broke into his home in Melbourne.
items.content: A father has been stabbed with a machete while trying to fight back against a gang who broke into his home in Melbourne.His wife was forced into a separate room with their two sleeping toddlers as the group - some teenagers - sped off in the couple's car.What happened in Kew East has left even senior detectives shaken.READ MORE: Light plane crash lands on Sydney golf course I've never seen anything like this, this is awful," Victoria Police's Leeanne Trusler said."There's nothing to indicate it being premeditated, they've just chosen this house and destroyed a family."The gang of five arrived on Oxford Street just before 4am today.Armed with a knife and machete, they used garden shears from the shed to smash a window.Once inside, they forced the husband and wife into separate rooms.READ MORE: Ratepayers have named the best local councils in Australia They stabbed the 39-year-old man 11 times.He was left with a broken arm and cuts to his face, and will need to undergo eye surgery.His parents were also cut and bruised as they tried to help."They're not used to people fighting back, and this home owner fought back," Trusler said."It's gotta stop. This has got to stop. Someone is going to be seriously hurt. Well, someone has now been seriously hurt. It's beyond a joke."His two kids, just two and three years old, thankfully slept through the attack.Their mother was treated for minor injuries while their nanny was uninjured."Aggravated burglaries, that have got to one every hour across the state are now getting to the stage they are so violent that we've now seen a father stabbed with his children at home and each and every Victorian will feel that today," Victoria's Opposition Leader Brad Battin said.Teenage boys aged 16 and 17 and a 24-year-old Caroline Springs man are being interviewed as police continue to search for the other offenders.Anyone who witnessed the incident, has CCTV/dashcam footage or any information that could assist police is urged to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or submit a confidential report online.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

items.title: Dad needs surgery after home invasion

items.content: A father needs surgery after being stabbed at his home in Melbourne.

clusters.ai_summary:
• A father was stabbed eleven times during a home invasion.
• The father was trying to fight back against the intruders.
• He requires surgery following the attack.
• The incident occurred at his home in Melbourne.
• Police are investigating the home invasion.

clusters.title: Lucky escape as light plane crash lands on Sydney golf course
clusters.neutral_headline: Light plane crashes on Sydney golf course, occupants survive

items.title: Lucky escape as light plane crash lands on Sydney golf course
items.standfirst: Two people have had an incredible escape after their light plane crashed into a golf course, walking away with just minor injuries.
items.content: Two people have had an incredible escape after their light plane crashed into a golf course, walking away with just minor injuries. The plane was on a training flight when it ran into engine trouble over Sydney's northern beaches.The single engine Piper Cherokee crash landed on Mona Vale Golf Course around 2.20pm today.READ MORE: 'Never seen anything like it': Dad, grandparents hurt with machete in home invasion It was a shock for golfers on a busy afternoon on the course."So I turned around and we all had a look and it was coming straight over our heads," one golfer told 9News."And Nick who was playing with us, his dad's in aviation, so he said run. "So we just ran towards the trees and we just watched the plane come down and you could see the wheels."The pilot and his student, both in their 50s walked away largely unharmed.Witnesses say they got out as golfers ran to help.READ MORE: 'It is time': Trump hands Putin letter written by wife Melania Chris Peck from NSW Ambulance said they only suffered a few cuts."The pilot and the trainee pilot had minor abrasions were coherent and [had a full] recollection of events."The men had flown from Camden skirting around Sydney's west before heading north. They lost power over Palm Beach and were told to head to Long Reef but couldn't make it.The Piper Cherokee sustained serious damage and the reason for the crash is now one for air safety investigators.The light plane will remain on the course overnight, with insurers to organise it's removal from tomorrow.However, this could take a few days due to the hilly terrain around the site and fact that the ground's currently too wet for heavy machinery.This means part of the golf course will remain closed for a few days. DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

items.title: Two people walk away after light plane crashes on Sydney golf course

clusters.ai_summary:

items.title: Thongs the only requirement at this bush weekender turned nudist haven
